bibl.note: This is a letter from Governor James K. Polk to Charles Clay Trabue, mayor of Nashville. It is dated December 10, 1839. Polk is writing to say that there is no legal basis for the resolution that Trabue has recently passed.

div.p: In answer to your letter of the 9th Instant, transmitting to me a copy of a resolution passed by the Mayor and statesman of the corporation of Nashville, passed, on the 12th of November 1839_ and requesting for the use of the City authorities, a portion of the public army of the state, to be returned on demand, I have to state that I do not find any law, which authorizes the executive to make such a disposition of the public army as that which you request.
